title: Environment
description: I've worked on multiple environment, being UNIX based or on Windows. But in the end i alwyas endup going back to UNIX like envs because of how practical it is when it comes to updates and package management

title: Front End Development
description: Being React or VueJS i can adapt to both, they are pretty similar overall. I like the component based architecture of Vue while i prefer the React's syntax. If i had to choose one i'll go for react just for the syntax and the ecosystem !

title: Back End Development
description: While i really enjoy the OOP and ecosystem of Java (and especially with springboot 2), i've mostly worked with php (symfony & drupal) and nodejs. I'm trying to pull of more work on Java and Golang because they are much more robust in micro-service architectures (which i find amazing)

title: DevOps
description: I think every developer should have basic skills when it comes to IT and Deployment. The Docker/Kubernetes ecosystem is AMAZING. A company that starts growing and plans on going the microservice way should absolutely go on container based apps paired with a CI/CD !!

title: Project Management
description: I've been working with the Agile method for 2 years now, i'm used to work with thing such as: poker planning, daily scrum, kaban board, sprint planning and so on...

title: I'm only Human Afterall
description: Usually forgotten, but we are all Humans. I always try my best to make my colleagues job easyer, share some culture, interest or simply play games with them (can't beat me at Tarrot i'm sorry !). I've done a 'Music of the day' playlist for my last company they can enjoy every kind of music everyday
